title: One-dimensional Dunkl Quantum Mechanics: A Path Integral Approach
authors: A. Benchikha, B. Hamil, B. C. L\"utf\"uo\u{g}lu and B.Khantoul
abstract:
In the present manuscript, we employ the Feynman path integral method to
derive the propagator in one-dimensional Wigner-Dunkl quantum mechanics. To
verify our findings we calculate the propagator associated with the free
particle and the harmonic oscillator in the presence of the Dunkl derivative.
We also deduce the energy spectra and the corresponding bound-state wave
functions from the spectral decomposition of the propagator.
